AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation.synopsis: AD the adventurer leader says just before running into the Den to confront the tiefling leader.

AD_WyllCharge.synopsis: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.

AD_GoblinCaptain.synopsis: A goblin veteran leading a raid on a druid grove - he's giving orders to his troops

AD_AdventurerWakesUp.synopsis: Player when the adventurer leader wakes up after being knocked out in the confrontation of Raiding Party.

Adventurer1.synopsis: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.

VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.synopsis: VB played after the adventurer leader has fled the DEN in Raiding Party.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.synopsis: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.

AD_AdventurerLeaderRant.synopsis: Complaint the adventurer leader says after the goblins have been dealt with, before returning to the Den after the gates are opened.

AD_TieflingLeaderRant.synopsis: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.

AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.synopsis: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.

PleaAtTheGate.synopsis: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.

AD_TieflingWakesUp.synopsis: Player when the tiefling leader wakes up after being knocked out in the confrontation of Raiding Party.

Adventurer2.synopsis:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.

AdventurerAfterKO.synopsis: After the main confrontation dialogue, one leader may attack the other. This dialogue the plays if the Adventurer Leader is the sole survivor regardless of who attacked who.
AdventurerAfterKO.how_to_trigger: Repro Steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 212.35, 26.28, 400.384. Advance towards the gate to trigger Attack on Den cinematic.5. killcombat6. Advance into the Grove.7. KO or let Zevlor KO Aradin.8. Talk with Aradin

AD_LeadersArgue.synopsis: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.

AdventurerLeader.synopsis: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.synopsis: READ IN FULL, YOU HAVE TO SCROLL DOWN:VB that plays after DEN_RaidingParty_Confrontation. The dialog ends either with peace having been achieved or with one leader being knocked out by either the opposing leader or a player.This VB has a greeting for each outcome, but there really are three main categories: Player punched a leader, the leaders punched each other OR piece was achieved.Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the player who was in the Confrontation dialog, and as such may have punched one of the leaders.Speaker 2 is an accompanying character and as such may be opinionated.

AD_Adventurer2AtGate.synopsis: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.

AD_TieflingLeaderSpotsWyll.synopsis: Plays when Avatar is Wyll in raiding party, during combat.

AD_Adventurer1AtGate.synopsis: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.

VB_ApproachingGate.synopsis: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.synopsis: Plea from the adventurer leader at the gates - goblins are almost here, he needs Zevlor to open up! Zevlor is being circumspect.

OpenGate.synopsis: The goblins have been narrowly beaten. From on top of the tall front gate, Zevlor shouts down to us, then to someone relatively on his level to open the gate.

AD_WyllWantsOut.synopsis: AD used by Wyll when his first combat turn against the goblin raiders start. This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!

VB_PeacefulResolution.synopsis: VB if everyone survived the confrontation in Raiding Party.

Confrontation.synopsis: After the goblins' raid on Halsin's camp, the tiefling leader berates the adventurers for causing trouble. The situation can escalate until one leader is knocked out, or it can be descalated with the aid of the player.
Confrontation.how_to_trigger: - ReCon: loadlevel WLD_Main_A- ReCon: goto 206.37, 30.50, 469.96- Wait until Aradin and his party run inside.- The dialogue should trigger automatically.

reasoning: The session 'PleaAtTheGate' is the initial situation where adventurers are pleading to be let in, which should logically precede any confrontation or decision-making sessions.
The session 'Confrontation' happens after 'PleaAtTheGate', as it involves a direct conflict between the tiefling leader and the adventurers, arising from the situation established in 'PleaAtTheGate'.
The session 'PAD_ConfrontationResolved' follows 'Confrontation' since it deals with the aftermath of the confrontation, indicating a resolution or continuation of the conflict.
The session 'AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation' logically precedes 'Confrontation', as it sets up the adventurer leader's actions just before the conflict.
The session 'VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves' follows 'PAD_ConfrontationResolved' since it indicates the adventurer leader leaving after the confrontation has been resolved.
The session 'AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate' is a plea made by the adventurer leader at the gates before the confrontation, which should come before 'Confrontation'.
The sessions 'AD_Adventurer2AtGate' and 'AD_Adventurer1AtGate' are pleas made by other adventurers at the gates and should precede 'Confrontation'.
The session 'VB_PeacefulResolution' can only occur if the confrontation resolves peacefully, making it exclusive to the 'PAD_ConfrontationResolved' session where peace is achieved.
If the adventurer leader is the only survivor in 'AdventurerAfterKO', it indicates that the conflict led to a significant outcome, so it can be seen as a follow-up to 'PAD_ConfrontationResolved'.

AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation_0.text: One less demon to worry about.

AD_WyllCharge_0.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllCharge_0.text: By sickle and sword, strike them down!

AD_WyllCharge_1.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllCharge_1.text: Don't falter now. Blades high, arrows nocked!

AD_GoblinCaptain_1.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain_1.text: Scouts - get to the high ground. Raiders - charge the bastards!
AD_GoblinCaptain_1.context: NodeContext: Shouting commands to his troops as they enter combat

AD_GoblinCaptain_0.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain_0.context: NodeContext: A warcry to his new god, the Absolute

AD_AdventurerWakesUp_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerWakesUp_0.context: NodeContext: Just waking up from being knocked out, rubbing his jaw.

Adventurer1_0.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1_0.text: Damn coward's got plenty to answer for.
Adventurer1_0.context: NodeContext: Goblins are defeated, but party isn't behind the gates yet.

Adventurer1_1.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1_1.context: NodeContext: The confrontation with Zevlor has been resolved. He's exhausted.

Adventurer1_2.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1_2.context: NodeContext: After the battle with the goblins

Adventurer1_3.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1_3.text: They nearly left us to the goblins. Disgusting.
Adventurer1_3.context: NodeContext: During Aradin's confrontation with Zevlor. Incensed.

VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves_0.speaker: Player
VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves_0.context: NodeContext: Situation didn't pan out very well - but no-one died. Slightly relieved but unsure.

VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves_1.speaker: Player
VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves_1.context: NodeContext: Someone has remarked 'it could have been worse'

PAD_RaidersDefeated_2.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated_2.text: Was that an ordinary raid? Seemed a fool's errand.

PAD_RaidersDefeated_1.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated_1.text: They likely have a camp nearby. I'd expect more raiders eventually.

AD_AdventurerLeaderRant_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderRant_0.context: NodeContext: If Zevlor is dead, Aradin sees his corpse

AD_AdventurerLeaderRant_1.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderRant_1.context: NodeContext: With hatred in his voice. About to go start a big fight.

AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened_0.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened_0.text: The danger has passed - for now. Open the gates.
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a high pointl

PleaAtTheGate_1.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate_1.text: That pack of goblins will be on us any second!

PleaAtTheGate_16.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: to KanonNodeContext: to Kanon

PleaAtTheGate_8.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate_8.text: Goblins are on our tail. Open the gate, Zevlor. Now.

PleaAtTheGate_12.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate_12.text: You led goblins here? Where is the druid?

PleaAtTheGate_3.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate_3.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A4 - Aradin : Arguing upward with Zevlor / picking up arrow from Barth sheild and showing it to Zevlor as a proof
 Barth : Alert of the danger / Get distracted by Aradin
NodeContext: Desperate

PleaAtTheGate_2.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A5 - Zevlor: Looking at Aradin / His attention is cought in the horison
Aradin: Looking at Zevlor / Turn around, his attention is cought in the horison
Barth : Alerted and scanning around
Remira : Alerted and scanning around
Worg : Voice is OFFscreen

PleaAtTheGate_18.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate_18.text: By the Nine Hells. Open the gate!
PleaAtTheGate_18.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A6 - Worg : Slowly stop on a perfect menacing position
Zevlor : Not in shot

PleaAtTheGate_11.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A8 - Kanon : Run toward the Wheel / Start turning it
Arka : Goes to a nearby stand to pick-up weapon / Look at Kanon
NodeContext: Both Alerte-ready for duties, worried

PleaAtTheGate_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: A9 - Bow are armed and arrow are shot. The Goblin are hiding in the bushes, this is an ambush. ( mocap one multiple time  (3 is good))

PleaAtTheGate_6.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate_6.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A10 - Kanaon : Wile he turn the wheel, he get shot in the neck. As he fall, he let go the wheel.
Arka : Avoid the volley of arrows (knock down the Sword Rack) / See Kanon body fall on ground
Zevlor : Avoid the volley of arrows / See Kanon get hitNodeContext: Caught by suprise, Like loosing his best friend

PleaAtTheGate_7.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A11 - A12 - 
Aradin : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back /Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now
Barth : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back / Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now
Remira : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back / Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now

PleaAtTheGate_13.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A13 - Worg : Hungry / start advancing
Goblins : Screaming / Charging / passing by the Worg and the cameras (for some)NodeContext: Hungry for human flesh

PleaAtTheGate_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll leaps from the wall, dispatching goblins set to ambush Aradin and company.

PleaAtTheGate_0.speaker: Wyll
PleaAtTheGate_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll speaks his line as he leaps towards the goblin and runs it through.NodeContext: Confidently, heroically, but without rage or any conceit.

PleaAtTheGate_17.speaker: Wyll
PleaAtTheGate_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll finishes his line and spins back towards the camera, blade pointed forward.NodeContext: Confidently, heroically, but without rage or any conceit.

PleaAtTheGate_9.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate_9.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barth : From his position on his last shot, he get into his fighting stance
Aradin : From his position on his last shot, he get into his fighting stance
Remira : From her position on her last shot, she get into her fighting stance

AD_TieflingWakesUp_0.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingWakesUp_0.context: NodeContext: Aradin just punched him in the face. This is him waking up after getting knocked out.

Adventurer2_0.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_0.text: Said it from the start. Shouldn't have trusted those foulbloods.
Adventurer2_0.context: NodeContext: Very nasty. All-but-saying a slur re: tieflings

Adventurer2_1.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_1.text: I'm not bloody dying here. I won't.
Adventurer2_1.context: NodeContext: She's waiting for Zevlor to open the gates since goblisn are coming.

AdventurerAfterKO_1.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerAfterKO_1.text: First I damn near die at the hands of goblins. Then a foulblood takes his frustrations out on me.

AdventurerAfterKO_0.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerAfterKO_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: He clears his throat, looking flustered as he barks at the tieflings. NodeContext: Flustered and then angry. Trying to be authorative and threatening. Pushing the panic and fear down.

AdventurerAfterKO_2.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerAfterKO_2.text: First I damn near die at the hands of goblins. Then I get sucker-punched by a bloody randomer.

AD_LeadersArgue_3.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue_3.text: You led them to our door.

AD_LeadersArgue_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue_0.text: And you was ready to let 'em have us.

AD_LeadersArgue_8.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue_8.text: Don't blame me for your idiotic mistakes.

AD_LeadersArgue_9.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue_9.text: I blame you for lockin' us out. Leavin' us to die.

AD_LeadersArgue_7.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue_7.text: I should've known. Can't trust a devil.

AD_LeadersArgue_1.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue_1.text: Watch your tongue. Before it's too late.

AdventurerLeader_0.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerLeader_0.text: Out of my way. I'll tear the horns off that bloody coward!
AdventurerLeader_0.context: NodeContext: Furious at Zevlor, who nearly locked him out of the grove.

AdventurerLeader_1.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerLeader_1.context: NodeContext: 'Pardon' is drected at a tiefling. Full of disdain.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved_0.text: He'll feel that in the morning.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved_3.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved_3.text: Now that that's settled, we can get to finding a healer.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved_1.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved_1.text: You heard them. More goblins could be on their way.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved_6.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved_6.text: I'm more worried about this parasite than a few goblins. We need a healer.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved_2.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved_2.text: Oof - I bet he broke that tiefling's nose. Friendly place.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved_7.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved_7.text: Let's try to avoid any more punching - we need to find a healer.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved_4.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved_4.text: He'll feel that in the morning.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved_5.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved_5.text: Oof - I bet he broke his nose. Friendly place.

AD_Adventurer2AtGate_0.speaker: Remira
AD_Adventurer2AtGate_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor. NodeContext: Terrified. Thinks she's about to die.

AD_Adventurer1AtGate_0.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer1AtGate_0.text: Hurry! Please! The goblins are on us!
AD_Adventurer1AtGate_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor.NodeContext: Panicked and terrified. About to die.

VB_ApproachingGate_0.speaker: Player
VB_ApproachingGate_0.text: We should check it out - but be careful.

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_0.text: Open the gate, you stubborn bastard!

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_4.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_4.text: Open up or I'll break the bloody thing down!

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_2.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_2.text: Look - please, just let us in. They're almost on us.
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_2.context: NodeContext: Still angry but trying to be reasonable.

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_1.speaker: Kanon
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate_1.text: He's been alerted. I won't leave my post.

OpenGate_1.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGate_1.text: That was the last of them. Inside - all of you. More may follow.
OpenGate_1.context: NodeContext: Shouted down to us - at the bottom of the gate

OpenGate_0.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGate_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Zevlor calls for gate to open (custom camera)NodeContext: Calling out o someone standing on his level, but not extremely close.

AD_WyllWantsOut_0.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllWantsOut_0.text: Bastards. The Blade comes for you.
AD_WyllWantsOut_0.context: NodeContext: This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!

VB_PeacefulResolution_1.speaker: Player
VB_PeacefulResolution_1.context: NodeContext: A massive argument has just died down thanks to you. You're relieved and also surprised at how tense it was. Commenting on situation.

VB_PeacefulResolution_0.speaker: Player
VB_PeacefulResolution_0.text: Yes. It's a good thing we were here.

Confrontation_62.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_62.text: There are children here, you fool!
Confrontation_62.context: CinematicNodeContext:  NodeContext: Absolutely furious.  He and his crew nearly died. Right in Zevlor's face.

Confrontation_116.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_116.text: We was running for our lives.
Confrontation_116.context: NodeContext: Exasperated. Thinks Zevlor is just being unreasonable.

Confrontation_39.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_39.text: You led them straight to us. And you let them take the druid, too. Unbelievable!
Confrontation_39.context: NodeContext: He's completely lost his temper at this point. Words are spat out.

Confrontation_57.speaker: Player
Confrontation_57.text: Where there's one goblin, there's ten. I'm leaving before the horde shows up.

Confrontation_15.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_15.text: They're right. We should scram while we can.

Confrontation_44.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_44.text: Right. Lead goblins here, then leave the rest of us to fight them off. You coward.
Confrontation_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rolls his eyes in exasperation at the player and then points at Aradin.NodeContext: Disgusted with Aradin. Oozing with derision.

Confrontation_84.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_84.text: What's it gonna take to shut you up, horns?

Confrontation_2.speaker: Player
Confrontation_2.text: One fight just ended, and now you're picking another? Relax.

Confrontation_134.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_134.text: Tell that to the dead at the gate.

Confrontation_46.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_46.text: Shut it, horns. I'd be lying dead next to the goblins if you'd stalled any longer.
Confrontation_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Points at Zevlor on first phrase - violent gesture. Emphasis on 'I'd' since he's responding to Zevlor talking of the deadNodeContext: Trying to turn the tide. Accusation is strong in his voice,

Confrontation_114.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_114.text: My duty is to this camp.

Confrontation_27.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_27.text: God forbid you risk your precious tail. But I shouldn't be surprised.

Confrontation_32.speaker: Player
Confrontation_32.text: Want me to knock you both out? Or would you prefer to skip the broken bones and just calm down?

Confrontation_98.speaker: Player
Confrontation_98.text: If you want me to take both of you down, I will. Otherwise, knock it off.

Confrontation_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling lands a glancing blow across the man's temple.

Confrontation_17.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_17.text: *With a thunk, the armoured man collapses - unconscious.*
Confrontation_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aradin falls to the ground

Confrontation_61.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_61.text: The goblins have found us. No doubt, the beasts will be back.

Confrontation_149.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_149.text: We need to pack up and leave. Immediately.
Confrontation_149.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns and prepares to leave.

Confrontation_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: In one swift move, the armoured man's fist makes contact with a sickening crunch.

Confrontation_60.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_60.text: Shoulda done that a long time ago. Arrogant prick had it out for me from day one.

Confrontation_65.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_65.text: No one leaves my people out cold.

Confrontation_38.speaker: Player
Confrontation_38.text: You put him in a bind, showing up like that. And he did try to open the gate.

Confrontation_108.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_108.text: He was right, though. Coming back to this hellhole was a mistake no amount of gold can put right.

Confrontation_47.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_47.text: I'd rather face another round of goblins than stay in this pit.

Confrontation_48.speaker: Player
Confrontation_48.text: So you knocked him out cold instead. Clever.

Confrontation_73.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_73.text: Only way he'd shut that hole under his nose.

Confrontation_49.speaker: Player
Confrontation_49.text: More violence won't bring back those you lost. Stop and think.

Confrontation_75.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_75.text: You're right. There's too much at stake.

Confrontation_88.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_88.text: Worried about your precious hides, the both of you.
Confrontation_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyebrow raised. Imperious. NodeContext: Seething with arrogance and a superiority complex.

Confrontation_28.speaker: Player
Confrontation_28.text: He's human - malice comes as naturally as breathing. Just show him you're the better man.

Confrontation_21.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_21.text: Forgive me, cousin. I... forgot myself.
Confrontation_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks from his hands to you. NodeContext: Speaking to a fellow tiefling. Ashamed at what he's done and that he's let you down.

Confrontation_97.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_97.text: We have people to protect. Let us work towards that.
Confrontation_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to Aradin. NodeContext: Anger has mainly disappeared. Disgusted with himself but trying to lead. Still arrogant.

Confrontation_119.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_119.text: *You see the tiefling's jaw clench. He's about to erupt.*
Confrontation_119.context: NodeContext: High tension. About to rear back and punch Aradin

Confrontation_13.speaker: Player
Confrontation_13.text: STOP OR I'LL BASH YOUR SKULLS TOGETHER MYSELF.

Confrontation_35.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_35.text: Enough. Squabbling is pointless. The goblins have found us.

Confrontation_10.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_10.text: At least we agree on that.

Confrontation_66.speaker: Player
Confrontation_66.text: Take a swing at the tiefling.

Confrontation_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: player punches Zevlor on the jaw, knocking him down

Confrontation_63.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_63.text: Damn. You knocked him clean out.

Confrontation_109.speaker: Player
Confrontation_109.text: I prefer to settle matters with my own hands.

Confrontation_107.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_107.text: Aradin Beno. Leader of the Beno Boys. Adventurers for hire 'n all.

Confrontation_67.speaker: Player
Confrontation_67.text: You're not locals, then. Who runs this place?

Confrontation_165.speaker: Player
Confrontation_165.text: Got a healer in your crew?

Confrontation_115.speaker: Player
Confrontation_115.text: What would be nice is a healer. Do me a favour and point me to one.

Confrontation_126.speaker: Player
Confrontation_126.text: I didn't do it for your praise. Just tell me what this place is.

Confrontation_78.speaker: Player
Confrontation_78.text: Ah, 'devilkin'. Certainly never heard that one before. Creative.

Confrontation_139.speaker: Player
Confrontation_139.text: I'm sure you think so. Now point me to a healer.

Confrontation_110.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_110.text: You're outta luck. Halsin - druid who runs this place - knew his stuff. But he ain't here anymore.

Confrontation_87.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_87.text: Got himself nabbed by gobbos - same ones what chased us here.

Confrontation_53.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_53.text: He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

Confrontation_113.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_113.text: Think he's got an apprentice running around somewheres, though. Nadine? Natalie? Something like that.

Confrontation_79.speaker: Player
Confrontation_79.text: What was important enough to drag a druid out of his grove?

Confrontation_52.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_52.text: We've got a contract to track down some relic, and he wanted in on the job. Eyes lit up when he heard about it.

Confrontation_34.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_34.text: I told him he wasn't getting so much as a sniff of the reward, but he tagged along anyhow.

Confrontation_33.speaker: Player
Confrontation_33.text: Maybe I could take that job off your hands, if you've lost your appetite for it.

Confrontation_1.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_1.text: Got a death wish, have you? Contract came from a wizard in Baldur's Gate.

Confrontation_164.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_164.text: Relic's supposedly hidden underneath a temple 'round these parts, and he'll pay gobloads for it.

Confrontation_159.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_159.text: But all that gold ain't gonna do you any good if you're too cold to spend it.

Confrontation_96.speaker: Player
Confrontation_96.text: Spare me the chilling warnings and just tell me where I can find this thing.

Confrontation_162.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_162.text: If I knew that, I wouldn't be back here with half my crew gone.

Confrontation_157.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_157.text: But look, if you're itching to meet Kelemvor, I won't stop you.

Confrontation_121.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_121.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

Confrontation_40.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_40.text: I'd give you the map and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.

Confrontation_155.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_155.text: All I've got's the contract. It'll show you where we turned back, if you feel like dying.
Confrontation_155.context: InternalNodeContext: Needs a mapmarker for goblins

Confrontation_14.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_14.text: Heh, don't thank me. I'll be well on my way to Baldur's Gate when you die.

Confrontation_143.speaker: Player
Confrontation_143.text: And you left him where, exactly?

Confrontation_152.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_152.text: Gobbos are holed up in the temple ruins out west of here - last I saw Halsin, he was right in the thick of 'em.

Confrontation_135.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_135.text: If you head that way, you'll likely smell 'em or hear their drums before you see 'em.

Confrontation_6.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_6.text: Head back to Baldur's Gate. Better empty-handed than dead. I'm done with this shite.

Confrontation_71.speaker: Player
Confrontation_71.text: Somewhere in my noxious blood, Baldur's Gate is calling to me.

Confrontation_16.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_16.text: Tough hitter like you might last there. Maybe.

Confrontation_167.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_167.text: Look me up if you're ever in the city. I owe you a pint.

Confrontation_99.speaker: Player
Confrontation_99.text: There are cut-throats there who'll leave you empty-handed and dead, just so you know.

Confrontation_148.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_148.text: True enough. City's got pubs, though, don't it?

Confrontation_169.speaker: Player
Confrontation_169.text: Haven't seen any signs of a city in these parts. How far is it?

Confrontation_163.speaker: Player
Confrontation_163.text: Baldur's Gate is legendary. I've never clapped eyes on it, personally.

Confrontation_91.speaker: Player
Confrontation_91.text: Best of luck. Hope your next contract's more fruitful.

Confrontation_68.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_68.text: Keep that luck, mate. You'll need it.

Confrontation_7.speaker: Player
Confrontation_7.text: Home sweet home. How far down the Chionthar are we?

Confrontation_120.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_120.text: Far enough that I ain't sure we'll make it back in one piece. And before you ask, I ain't takin' tag-alongs.

Confrontation_4.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_4.text: Tell you what, though: look me up if you're ever in the city. I owe you a pint.

Confrontation_72.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_72.text: Ain't stayin' around here with this'n knocked cold out. Here's hopin' they'll grant mercy to one of their own.

Confrontation_106.speaker: Player
Confrontation_106.text: The Gate will take you for all you're worth with a smile. At least goblins rob you proper.

Confrontation_158.speaker: Player
Confrontation_158.text: Before you go, let me see that contract. Maybe I'll fare better than you did.

Confrontation_141.speaker: Player
Confrontation_141.text: No points for effort. Care to tell me what this place is?

Confrontation_92.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_92.text: It's a druids' grove - fella in charge went by the name Halsin. He ain't here anymore, though.

Confrontation_82.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player starts to react, but is cut off

Confrontation_125.speaker: Player
Confrontation_125.text: Aim a blow at the human, trying to knock him flat on his back.

Confrontation_42.speaker: Player
Confrontation_42.text: Druid? Those goblins didn't take any prisoners.

Confrontation_127.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_127.text: We lost him back at the ruins - whole place is crawling with gobbos.

Confrontation_19.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_19.text: Nobody forced him to go with us - he insisted. And when things got tough, he couldn't keep up. Simple as that.

Confrontation_30.speaker: Player
Confrontation_30.text: You can cough up my payment any time now.

Confrontation_146.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_146.text: Stuff your payment. I didn't ask for any goddamn help.

Confrontation_93.speaker: Player
Confrontation_93.text: Ah, backstabbing. This feels just like home.

Confrontation_24.speaker: Player
Confrontation_24.text: Stop squealing like hatchlings or settle this matter in blood.

Confrontation_58.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_58.text: What chewed you up and spit you out?

Confrontation_101.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_101.text: Show some respect! If not for them, your pathetic life would be over.

Confrontation_136.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_136.text: Well, I didn't ask for any goddamn help.

Confrontation_12.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_12.text: Please. You were begging me to open the gate. Anything to save yourself, you coward.

Confrontation_145.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_145.text: *The human's eye twitches. He's about to blow.*
Confrontation_145.context: NodeContext: High tension moment. Violence is about to erupt.

Confrontation_124.speaker: Player
Confrontation_124.text: Aim a blow at the human.

Confrontation_104.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player punches Aradin, Aradin gets knocked out

Confrontation_137.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation_137.context: NodeContext: He's happy but it's outside his zone of comfort (being a teacher)

Confrontation_81.speaker: Player
Confrontation_81.text: How about we cool those hot tempers and talk this through calmly?

Confrontation_70.speaker: Player
Confrontation_70.text: I've seen much bloodier battles than this. Consider yourselves lucky.

Confrontation_69.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation_69.text: And who the hell are you again?!

Confrontation_170.speaker: Player
Confrontation_170.text: What's unbelievable is how we beat the goblins! You're both heroes.
